author: Jake Maxwell Watts
title: U.S.-China Trade Spat Puts Southeast Asian Leaders on Edge
text:
SINGAPORE—Southeast Asian leaders at a regional summit here worry that their countries are among the most exposed to the negative effects of a U.S.-China trade war, with the knock-on costs of tariffs likely to ripple through global supply chains, costing billions of dollars in lost income.
The deepening conflict between the world’s two largest economies has put leaders at the summit on edge as they look for ways to prevent their trade-dependent economies from becoming collateral damage in the dispute.
... RELATED VIDEO The Tech Arms Race Driving the U.S.-China Trade Dispute “Made in China 2025” is Beijing’s industrial plan to dominate high-tech industries including robotics, aerospace and computer chips. The Trump administration argues China is using the plan to give its tech companies unfair advantage over foreign rivals. But what is it exactly?
